channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [FLINK-21103] E2e tests time out on azure
item.description:

item.summary: E2e tests time out on azure

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Another case: https://dev.azure.com/apache-flink/apache-flink/_build/results?buildId=13183&view=logs&j=c88eea3b-64a0-564d-0031-9fdcd7b8abee&t=ff888d9b-cd34-53cc-d90f-3e446d355529

this seems suspicious

2021-02-10T08:31:29.2869114Z Feb 10 08:31:29 Waiting for job to process up to 1000 records, current progress: 0 records ...
2021-02-10T08:31:36.9183883Z Feb 10 08:31:36 Waiting for job to process up to 1000 records, current progress: 0 records ...

2021-02-10T08:32:10.9063618Z /home/vsts/work/1/s/flink-end-to-end-tests/test-scripts/test_stream_state_ttl.sh: line 78: local: can only be used in a function
2021-02-10T08:32:10.9066458Z Feb 10 08:32:10 Checking for non-empty .out files...
2021-02-10T08:32:10.9262590Z Feb 10 08:32:10 No non-empty .out files.
2021-02-10T08:32:10.9358556Z Feb 10 08:32:10 Checking of logs skipped.
2021-02-10T08:32:10.9359359Z Feb 10 08:32:10 
2021-02-10T08:32:10.9361173Z Feb 10 08:32:10 [PASS] 'State TTL Heap backend end-to-end test' passed after 95 minutes and 38 seconds! Test exited with exit code 0.

Looks like this test is causing the e2e job to time out.

Another case https://dev.azure.com/apache-flink/98463496-1af2-4620-8eab-a2ecc1a2e6fe/_apis/build/builds/13184/logs/170

Here I may have gotten some root cause

...
 
2021-02-10T12:19:49.2341516Z Feb 10 12:19:49 Waiting for job to process up to 1000 records, current progress: 0 records ...
2021-02-10T12:19:50.3102689Z /home/vsts/work/1/s/flink-end-to-end-tests/test-scripts/test_stream_state_ttl.sh: line 78: local: can only be used in a function
2021-02-10T12:19:50.3104782Z Feb 10 12:19:50 Checking for non-empty .out files...
2021-02-10T12:19:50.3264423Z Feb 10 12:19:50 No non-empty .out files.
2021-02-10T12:19:50.3363980Z Feb 10 12:19:50 Checking of logs skipped.
2021-02-10T12:19:50.3364793Z Feb 10 12:19:50 
2021-02-10T12:19:50.3366101Z Feb 10 12:19:50 [PASS] 'State TTL Heap backend end-to-end test' passed after 95 minutes and 31 seconds! Test exited with exit code 0.
2021-02-10T12:19:50.3366756Z Feb 10 12:19:50

So I think we have 3 issues:
1. The test itself fails, possibly with a production-code bug.

2. Job restarts but is not tracked properly (test bug).

3. Some cleanup in the test fails leading to a passed test altough it failed.

Might be initially exposed to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-20675 yunta.

However the recent frequent failures (since yesterday this became much more unstable) looks like are related to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-21206 dwysakowicz.
I think there are two separate issues as Piotr mentioned. One is caused by FLINK-21206. I will revert commits that cause it and at the same time I will work on a fix.

Reverted the cause for the recent failures on master in:

  • 2445a3faf1493785b481d9b9b1fe8c8ea81da0ec
  • 3187c3431039c261b81fd641a157c6fb1e37a4bb

E2e tests keep timing out. This time on 1.12 branch: https://dev.azure.com/apache-flink/apache-flink/_build/results?buildId=13475&view=logs&j=91bf6583-3fb2-592f-e4d4-d79d79c3230a&t=3425d8ba-5f03-540a-c64b-51b8481bf7d6

https://dev.azure.com/apache-flink/apache-flink/_build/results?buildId=13947&view=logs&j=c88eea3b-64a0-564d-0031-9fdcd7b8abee&t=ff888d9b-cd34-53cc-d90f-3e446d355529

 

https://dev.azure.com/apache-flink/apache-flink/_build/results?buildId=13963&view=logs&j=c88eea3b-64a0-564d-0031-9fdcd7b8abee&t=ff888d9b-cd34-53cc-d90f-3e446d355529

 

https://dev.azure.com/apache-flink/apache-flink/_build/results?buildId=13960&view=logs&j=c88eea3b-64a0-564d-0031-9fdcd7b8abee&t=ff888d9b-cd34-53cc-d90f-3e446d355529

Checking the latest two building logs in the above comments, we could see the below cases run for specially long time, and I suggest the PyFlink and SQL component owners to take a look dianfu jark:

[PASS] 'Run kubernetes pyflink application test' passed after 12 minutes and 49 seconds!
[PASS] 'Running Kerberized YARN per-job on Docker test (default input)' passed after 8 minutes and 24 seconds!
[PASS] 'TPC-DS end-to-end test (Blink planner)' passed after 19 minutes and 54 seconds!
[PASS] 'PyFlink end-to-end test' passed after 14 minutes and 41 seconds!
[PASS] 'PyFlink YARN per-job on Docker test' passed after 15 minutes and 26 seconds!

Logs I checked:

  • https://dev.azure.com/apache-flink/apache-flink/_build/results?buildId=13963&view=logs&j=c88eea3b-64a0-564d-0031-9fdcd7b8abee&t=ff888d9b-cd34-53cc-d90f-3e446d355529
  • https://dev.azure.com/apache-flink/apache-flink/_build/results?buildId=13966&view=logs&j=c88eea3b-64a0-564d-0031-9fdcd7b8abee&t=ff888d9b-cd34-53cc-d90f-3e446d355529

Thanks liyu for looking into it. Apart from 'Running Kerberized YARN per-job on Docker test (default input)' all the other tests has been taking that long since their introduction. It would be really nice if we could shorten their runtime, but I think those are not the root cause of the problem.

As for the 'Running Kerberized YARN per-job on Docker test (default input)' it did start to fail more often, even with longer times. We're tracking it in FLINK-21545. We are thinking about caching the docker images on azure machines.
We will introduce a cache for the binaries in FLINK-21561.

Thanks for the follow up dwysakowicz and rmetzger!

Let's try to be more thorough when checking the logs. I checked last few logs and they have a corresponding more specific tasks (e.g. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-21431 or https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-21963).
